;摘要

;对同行评审的文献进行了系统审查，以确定城市森林对降低邻近或下游水体中养分浓度的益处。筛选后，发现少量文章 (40) 是相关的，代表了量化城市和城郊环境中非点源养分损失的研究。证据分为地块规模和流域规模。地块规模的研究通常包括对基于自然的工程解决方案的评估。在集水区尺度上，溪流水质研究通常调查贡献集水区养分来源的影响。大范围的有益减少是显而易见的，并且在这两个尺度上并非所有研究都确定了显着的益处。在此背景下进行总结，在地块（微）规模林地中，径流、土壤或地下水中的总氮 (TN) 平均浓度平均降低 44.2%，总磷 (TP) 平均降低 47.0%。在集水区（中观）尺度上，有证据表明以混合城市肌理为代价增加 20% 的森林面积可以将 TN 和 TP 的平均浓度分别降低 15.7% 和 12.6%。此外，一些文章揭示了潜在的缺点，减少了行道树和河岸林地特别提供的好处。落在不透水表面上的落叶会增加 TP 浸入溪流的风险，但对 TN 影响不大。河岸林地被发现具有复杂的水质影响。树冠覆盖抑制了河道生物对氮的吸收，根据所有证据，这似乎相当可观。然而，未遮蔽的源头可以促进初级生产力的加速，并带来不良的下游后果。总体而言，鉴于当前的不确定性，我们鼓励收集更多证据，尤其是解决不透水、可渗透和河岸城市林地环境之间的差异。

;The Province of Ontario in Canada illustrates contemporary water security issues, where despite perception of water abundance, water challenges arise locally. Water risks stem from biophysical dimensions of groundwater depletion, low surface water flows, and degraded quality, and, contextual dimensions of regulatory uncertainty, public concerns and perception. While academic, policy, and practitioner interest is growing, literature reveals major gaps in comprehensive assessment of multi-dimensional water risks at the sub-watershed scale. The study finds high and moderate risk potential in at least 50% of studied sub-watersheds for all water risk indicators and challenges the myth of water abundance in Great Lakes watershed of Ontario. The study advances knowledge in water risk assessment by applying social ecological perspectives, interdisciplinary approaches of Risk Theory, and mixed methods to provide a comprehensive evaluation of water security and demonstrates integration of social science perspectives in the field of socio-hydrology. Our framework assesses interdisciplinary water risks to inform multi-sector sustainable water management decisions. While spatially scoped to populous sub-watersheds of Ontario, this framework can be methodologically generalized to other geographical regions by using local data.
